db.juhaku.juhakudb.filter

Class PredicateBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • db.juhaku.juhakudb.filter.PredicateBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PredicateBuilder.JunctionBuilder

    public class PredicateBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by juha on 03/05/17.

    This class provides builder functions to create WHERE clause of a SQL query.

    Since:
    2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PredicateBuilder.JunctionBuilder
      Junction builder provides isolated operator clause for WHERE clause.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PredicateBuilder()
      Instantiate new instance of predicate builder for creating advanced WHERE clauses.

      • setPageSize

        public PredicateBuilder setPageSize(java.lang.Integer pageSize)
        Set number of max results in one page. If this is filled then set page must be provided also. See setPage(Integer).
        Parameters:
        pageSize - Integer value of max page result.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • setPage

        public PredicateBuilder setPage(java.lang.Integer page)
        Set current page number for sql query. 0 will be the first page. If this is being used the page size also must be provided. See setPageSize(Integer).
        Parameters:
        page - Integer current page.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • in

        public PredicateBuilder in(java.lang.String field,
                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Creates IN statement for WHERE clause. This is equal to in(String, Collection) but it is provided as easy access for arrays.
        Parameters:
        field - String value of field to create in for.
        args - Array of args that are being substituted with question marks (?).
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • in

        public PredicateBuilder in(java.lang.String field,
                           java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> args)
        Creates IN statement for WHERE clause. E.g. id IN (?,?).
        Parameters:
        field - String field to create in statement for.
        args - Collection containing args that will be replaced by question marks (?) in query.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • in

        public PredicateBuilder in(Expression expression,
                           java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> args)
        Creates IN statement for WHERE clause with expressions. E.g. lower(name) IN (lower(?),lower(?)). Given collection of objects can be collection of expressions or basic types e.g. Integer or String.
        Parameters:
        expression - Expression to use for first value before IN word.
        args - Collection containing args that will be replaced by question marks (?) in query.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • eq

        public PredicateBuilder eq(java.lang.String field,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
        Create equals statement for WHERE clause. E.g. name = ?.
        Parameters:
        field - String field name to create equals statement for.
        arg - Object arg to be substituted with ?.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • eq

        public PredicateBuilder eq(Expression fieldExpression,
                           Expression argExpression)
        Create equals statement for WHERE clause by expressions. E.g. name = ?. Expression equals statement enables possibility to create fancy equals statements e.g. upper(name) = upper(?).
        Parameters:
        fieldExpression - Expression for field to be equal to something.
        argExpression - Expression that is being compared to against the fieldExpression. Value will be substituted with ? for SQL query.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • not

        public PredicateBuilder not()
        Create inverse statement to WHERE clause. Negation works with in, eq, between, isNull and like statements. E.g. builder.not().in(name, "john", "matt");

        This above statement will be translated to: NOT IN (?,?) instead of IN (?,?).

        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • isNull

        public PredicateBuilder isNull(java.lang.String field)
        Creates is null statement for given field. E.g. name IS NULL.
        Parameters:
        field - String field to be checked is being null or not.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • between

        public PredicateBuilder between(java.lang.String field,
                                java.lang.Object arg0,
                                java.lang.Object arg1)
        Creates between statement for given field where field values is between some values. E.g. age BETWEEN ? AND ?.
        Parameters:
        field - String field name to create between statement for.
        arg0 - Object first argument for between statement.
        arg1 - Object second argument for between statement.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • gt

        public PredicateBuilder gt(java.lang.String field,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
        Creates greater than statement for given field. E.g. age > ?.
        Parameters:
        field - String name of the field to create statement for.
        arg - Object argument to be substituted with ?.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • gt

        public PredicateBuilder gt(Expression fieldExpression,
                           Expression argExpression)
        Create greater than for WHERE clause by expressions. E.g. age > ?. Expression greater than statement enables possibility to create fancy greater than statements e.g. max(age) > avg(?).
        Parameters:
        fieldExpression - Expression for field to be greater than something.
        argExpression - Expression that is being compared to against the fieldExpression. Value will be substituted with ? for SQL query.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

        public PredicateBuilder ge(java.lang.String field,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
        Creates greater than or equal statement for given field. E.g. age >= ?.
        Parameters:
        field - String name of the field to create statement for.
        arg - Object argument to be substituted with ?.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • ge

        public PredicateBuilder ge(Expression fieldExpression,
                           Expression argExpression)

        Parameters:

        argExpression - Expression that is being compared to against the fieldExpression. Value will be substituted with ? for SQL query.

        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • like

        public PredicateBuilder like(java.lang.String field,
                             java.lang.Object arg)
        Creates like statement for provided field. E.g. field LIKE ?. Like statement can contain wild carts in the beginning and/or at the end of provided argument value.

        By default like statement is case insensitive.

        Parameters:
        field - String name of the field to create like statement for.
        arg - Object argument to be substituted with ?.
        Returns:
        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

        Predicate builder for current WHERE clause.

      • sqlPredicate

        public PredicateBuilder sqlPredicate(java.lang.String sql,
                                     java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> args)

      • conjunction

        public PredicateBuilder.JunctionBuilder conjunction()
        Creates new conjunction for current WHERE clause. Conjunction stands for grouped statement which is isolated with parentheses. E.g. (a AND b AND c...). This statement can contain only AND operators. Conjunction cannot contain another junction instead all junctions is to be added to root predicate builder for root WHERE clause.
        Returns:
        New junction builder for current WHERE clause to create isolated criteria for query.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT

      • disjunction

        public PredicateBuilder.JunctionBuilder disjunction()
        Creates new disjunction for current WHERE clause. Disjunction stands for grouped statement which is isolated with parentheses. E.g. (a OR b OR c...). This statement can contain only OR operators. Disjunction cannot contain another junction instead all junctions is to be added to root predicate builder for root WHERE clause.
        Returns:
        New junction builder for current WHERE clause to create isolated criteria for query.
        Since:
        2.0.2-SNAPSHOT
